column4: I'm currently at the xdm login screen on linux, but I'm ssh'd in and have a monitor hooked up (but no keyboard/mouse). Anyway I can login on X via ssh somehow?
You can use ssh -X to run X apps remotely
thanks, but that didn't answer my question :)
Do you have a separate /boot?
nope, its on the drive. hmm
hm, grub did ask me during the upgrade what drive i wanted to install it to... i didnt select any.. maybe that was my problem? i thought it would default to the drive it was on
Since grub is loading at all it must be installed
is it possible it's from 9.04?
no
it says grub 1.96
Try holding shift at boot so you can see the menu and press 'e' to edit the first entry. Remove the line starting with "search" and see if you can boot then
any tips? im on my phone with irc. hm, i could get into a live cd, maybe
ok, will do
Ahh, you installed grub2 early in jaunty
Yes, that's the jaunty version of grub2
ah, i see. how can i fix this?
hm, im on my phone. actually, i think i can pull up that url, let me try. thanks
np
why didn't ubuntu warn me this would happen? I would have selected a drive ... :/ I'm not complaining because of you, I know it's not your fault, but I think it'd be smart of ubuntu to warn me
There is a bug report about that
ah, ok, thanks
It's much worse for people upgrading from grub legacy because grub doesn't load at all
ah
